title: Yelena Hahn
summary: Yelena Andreyevna Hahn von Rottenstern (née Fadeyeva) (Russian: Елена Андреевна Ган, Ukrainian: Олена Андріївна Ган; 11 January 1814 - 6 July 1842) was a Russian writer known for her contributions to the literary journals Biblioteka Dlya Chteniya and Otechestvennye Zapiski. In addition to her literary works, she is known as the mother of Helena Blavatsky, founder of Theosophy.
